intro: Bupleurum rohlenae, commonly known as the Balkan angelica, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland and grassland habitats. Bupleurum rohlenae is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its delicate foliage and flowering display.
